author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.

author: Seneca
quote: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.

author: Epictetus
quote: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.

author: Seneca
quote: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.

author: Epictetus
quote: No man is free who is not master of himself.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: If it is not right, do not do it, if it is not true, do not say it.

author: Seneca
quote: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.

author: Epictetus
quote: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.

author: Seneca
quote: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.

author: Epictetus
quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.

author: Seneca
quote: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.

author: Epictetus
quote: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.

author: Seneca
quote: As is a tale, so is life: not how long it is, but how good it is, is what matters.

author: Epictetus
quote: Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it happens.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: To love only what happens, what was destined. No greater harmony.

author: Seneca
quote: True happiness is to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future.

author: Epictetus
quote: Man is not worried by real problems so much as by his imagined anxieties about real problems.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.

author: Seneca
quote: He suffers more than necessary, who suffers before it is necessary.

author: Epictetus
quote: If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them.

author: Seneca
quote: Associate with people who are likely to improve you.

author: Epictetus
quote: Don't demand that things happen as you wish, but wish that they happen as they do happen.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: When you arise in the morning think of what a privilege it is to be alive.

author: Seneca
quote: It is the power of the mind to be unconquerable.

author: Epictetus
quote: No great thing is created suddenly.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Reject your sense of injury and the injury itself disappears.

author: Seneca
quote: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.

author: Epictetus
quote: Remember, it is not enough to be hit or insulted to be harmed.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Look well into thyself; there is a source of strength which will always spring up if thou wilt always look.

author: Seneca
quote: True wisdom is knowing what you do not know.

author: Epictetus
quote: Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Do every act of your life as though it were the very last act of your life.

author: Seneca
quote: He who is brave is free.

author: Epictetus
quote: Circumstances don't make the man, they only reveal him to himself.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The object of life is not to be on the side of the majority, but to escape finding oneself in the ranks of the insane.

author: Seneca
quote: Begin at once to live and count each day as a separate life.

author: Epictetus
quote: It's not things themselves that disturb us, but our opinions about them.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.

author: Seneca
quote: Difficulties strengthen the mind as labor does the body.

author: Epictetus
quote: He is a wise man who does not grieve for the things which he has not, but rejoices for those which he has.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together.

author: Seneca
quote: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.

author: Epictetus
quote: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.
